title: Existing Buildings Energy Performance Ordinance Report
description: A. SUMMARY The Existing Buildings Energy Performance Ordinance (Environment Code Chapter 20) requires that each non-residential building with at least 10,000 square feet of conditioned (heated or cooled) space and each residential building with at least 50,000 square feet of conditioned space must be benchmarked annually using Energy Star Portfolio Manager. Each non-residential building specified above is also required to undergo an energy audit, retrocommissioning, or develop a plan for decarbonization at least once every 5 years. More information: San Francisco Existing Buildings Energy Ordinance Website B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED The data is sourced from the benchmark and energy audit reports submitted for compliance with Environment Code Chapter 20. The dataset is presented in two tables which together provide basic characteristics, compliance status, and a public record of reported energy performance. C. UPDATE PROCESS This dataset will be updated on a monthly basis. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET Existing Buildings - Basic Info and Audit Compliance Status -- This filtered view contains one record per building and provides basic characteristics (such as size and vintage). For commercial buildings, the table indicates when an energy audit or decarbonization plan is due. Existing Buildings - Benchmark Reports -- Each row of this filtered view presents one year of benchmarking data for one building – so there are multiple records per building. One year of data includes compliance status, and if the building complied it also presents energy use data including gas, electricity, steam and EPA-estimated operational carbon emissions. This dataset contains the information of the two views joined on Parcel Number.

columns.name: unique_identifier
columns.description: parcel_number + benchmark_year

columns.name: Parcel Number
columns.description: Assessor's Parcel Number

columns.name: Building Name
columns.description: The name of the building

columns.name: Building Address
columns.description: The location of the building

columns.name: Postal Code
columns.description: The zip code where building is located

columns.name: Floor Area
columns.description: Total property floor area, measured from the outside surface of the exterior walls of the building(s) not including parking

columns.name: Category
columns.description: The property's category (commercial, mixed residential, multifamily)

columns.name: Property Type - Self Selected
columns.description: The property type (or "primary function") the user selects.

columns.name: PIM Link
columns.description: Link to the Property Information Map (uses the parcel with the lowest numerical value)

columns.name: Year Built
columns.description: The year when the building was constructed

columns.name: Energy Audit Due Date
columns.description: The due date for the building's next energy audit

columns.name: Energy Audit Status
columns.description: The status of the building's energy audit

columns.name: Benchmark Year
columns.description: The year when the building's benchmark data was submitted

columns.name: ENERGY STAR Score
columns.description: The score of the building’s energy performance as calculated by EPA's ENERGYSTAR

columns.name: Site EUI (kBtu/ft2)
columns.description: Site energy delivered to a building divided by its gross floor area

columns.name: Source EUI (kBtu/ft2)
columns.description: Source Energy divided by the building's gross floor area

columns.name: Percent Better than National Median Site EUI
columns.description: Percent difference between the building's actual Site EUI and the National Median Site EUI (which is specific to the building)

columns.name: Weather Normalized Site EUI (kBtu/ft2)
columns.description: The energy use the building would have consumed during 30-year average weather conditions.

columns.name: Weather Normalized Source EUI (kBtu/ft2)
columns.description: The source energy use the building would have consumed during 30-year average weather conditions

columns.name: Total GHG Emissions (Metric Tons CO2e)
columns.description: Total of direct and indirect greenhouse gas emissions

columns.name: Total GHG Emissions Intensity (kGCO2e/ft2)
columns.description: The total GHG emissions divided by the building's gross floor area

columns.name: Electricity Use - Grid Purchase (kWh)
columns.description: The total electricity that the building used and purchased from the grid

columns.name: Natural Gas Use (kBtu)
columns.description: The total natural gas that the building used

columns.name: District Steam Use (kBtu)
columns.description: The total district steam that the building used

columns.name: Site Energy Use (kBtu)
columns.description: The annual amount of all the energy the building consumed on-site, regardless of the source

columns.name: Benchmark Status
columns.description: The benchmark compliance status for the building

columns.name: Reason for Exemption
columns.description: Building status that allows exemption from benchmarking as legally allowed by the ordinance

columns.name: point
columns.description: The latitude and longitude of the building location for mapping purposes

columns.name: longitude
columns.description: Longitude

columns.name: latitude
columns.description: Latitude

columns.name: analysis_neighborhood
columns.description: Neighborhood where building is located

columns.name: supervisor_district
columns.description: Numeric field for City and County Supervisor District where building is located

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp when the record (row) was last updated in the source system Date

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp when the record (row) was was last updated/ loaded into DataSF data portal
